item.description: 1 2 3 ---title:"Alpha-beta Pruning"--- Search algorithm that decreases the number of gate states to evaluate in [[notes/Minimax Algorithm|Minimax Algorithm]] in the game tree.
1 2 3 ---title:"Artificial Intelligence Concept Map"--- What is AI? From the name, it seems that the aim of artificial intelligence is to create artificially “intelligent” machines.

1 2 3 ---title:"Braitenberg vehicles"--- Source: Braitenberg Vehicle Wiki This was a thought experiment by Valentino Braitenberg. In the simplest form of this experiment, a Braitenberg vehicle is a machine with a light sensor and a motor.
1 2 3 ---title:"Ethics in AI"--- Filter Bubbles The goal of content recommendation systems, especially those used in social media/newsfeeds, is to provide personalized searches.

1 2 3 ---title:"First-Order Logic"--- GÃ¶del’s Theorems i.e. [[GÃ¶del’s Completeness Theorem|GÃ¶del’s Completeness Theorem]] and [[GÃ¶del’s Incompleteness Theorem|GÃ¶del’s Incompleteness Theorem|]] were important to AI.
1 2 3 ---title:"Generating Job Resources based on LinkedIn Job Descriptions"---

1 2 3 ---title:"Gesture Recognition with AI to improve Human-Computer Interactions"--- Overall Idea Desktop application that can detect hand gestures/ facial expressions and use them as keybinds, allowing them to function as shortcuts or commands.
1 2 3 ---title:"GÃ¶del's Completeness Theorem"--- For any collection of first-order statements, every semantic implication of those statements is syntactically provable within first-order logic.
1 2 3 ---title:"GÃ¶del's Incompleteness Theorem"--- Source: Numberphile on GÃ¶del’s Incompleteness Theorem The simple idea: There might be a conjecture that’s true, but there is no way to prove it.
1 2 3 ---title:"Image Feature Vector"--- A way to abstract information i.e. image, so that it’s numerically quantifiable. Simply put, a list of numbers that represents an image.
1 2 3 ---title:"Markdown Commands"--- A personal cheatsheet to various Markdown commands and keybindings to be used within Obsidian!
1 2 3 ---title:"Minimax Algorithm"--- Decision-theory concept. For simplicity, let’s consider it in the context of a two-player zero sum game like tic-tac-toe.
